revised_title: Countercurrent Catalytic Reactor: Mathematical Analysis and Performance Characteristics
tldr: The authors analyze the steady-state behavior of a countercurrent catalytic reactor for a reversible reaction-adsorption system under ideal chromatographic conditions. They investigate the interaction between the chemical reaction process and the adsorption process, which can break the local thermodynamic equilibrium limitation by forming a stationary shock front inside the reactor. The performance characteristics of the countercurrent reactor are compared with those of the conventional fixed-bed reactor.
